required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Investigational Study to Evaluate Experimental Medication BMS-986165 in Japanese Participants With Moderate-to-Severe Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Single-arm, Multi-Center, Phase 3 Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of BMS-986165 in Japanese Subjects With Moderate-to-Severe Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate BMS-986165 given to Japanese participants with moderate-to-severe psoriasis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who achieve static Physician's Global Assessment (sPGA) score of 0 to 1 response
primary_outcome.description: The sPGA score is the investigator's assessment of a participant's psoriasis lesions at a given point in time. Overall lesions are graded and averaged for thickness, erythema, and scaling based on a 0 (normal) to 4 (severe) scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who achieve PASI 75 (75% reduction in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index)
primary_outcome.description: The PASI is a scoring system used by investigators to grade the severity and extent of psoriatic lesions. In the PASI system, the body is divided into 4 regions: head, trunk, upper extremities, and lower extremities. Each of these areas is assessed separately for the percentage of the area involved and scored for erythema, induration, and scaling to generate a composite PASI score that ranges from 0 (normal) to 72 (most severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who achieve sPGA score of 0 or 1 response
secondary_outcome.description: The sPGA score is the investigator's assessment of a participant's psoriasis lesions at a given point in time. Overall lesions are graded and averaged for thickness, erythema, and scaling based on a 0 (normal) to 4 (severe) scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who achieve PASI 75
secondary_outcome.description: The PASI is a scoring system used by investigators to grade the severity and extent of psoriatic lesions. In the PASI system, the body is divided into 4 regions: head, trunk, upper extremities, and lower extremities. Each of these areas is assessed separately for the percentage of the area involved and scored for erythema, induration, and scaling to generate a composite PASI score that ranges from 0 (normal) to 72 (most severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who achieve PASI 90
secondary_outcome.description: At least 90% improvement in PASI scores from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who achieve PASI 100
secondary_outcome.description: 100% improvement in PASI scores from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: American College of Rheumatology Criteria (ACR20) response in participants with psoriatic arthritis
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed as a proportion of participants meeting ACR20 criteria, where a responder is defined if the following 3 conditions are met: ≥ 20% improvement from baseline in the number of tender joints (68 joint count) ≥ 20% improvement from baseline in the number of swollen joints (66 joint count) ≥ 20% improvement from baseline in 3 of the following 5 domains: Patient Global Assessment of joint disease (measured on a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS), 0-100) Physician Global Assessment of joint disease (measured on a VAS, 0-100) Patient assessment of joint pain (measured on a VAS, 0-100) Health Assessment Questionnaire- Disability Index (HAQ-DI) high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hs-CRP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the ACR core set in participants with psoriatic arthritis
secondary_outcome.description: Tender and swollen joint counts Patient global assessment of joint disease Physician global assessment of joint disease Patient assessment of joint pain HAQ-DI hs-CRP

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Psoriasis Symptoms and Signs Diary (PSSD) score
secondary_outcome.description: PSSD symptom score of 0 assessed as a proportion of participants with a PSSD symptom score of 0 among participants with a baseline PSSD symptom score ≥ 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who achieve Scalp Specific (ss)-PGA score 0 or 1 among participants with a baseline ss-PGA score ≥3
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of scalp psoriasis lesions as measured by ss-PGA

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who achieve PGA-F score 0 or 1 among participants with a baseline PGA-F score ≥3
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of fingernail psoriasis as measured by PGA-F among participants with a baseline PGA-F score >= 3

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants who achieve palmoplantar (pp)-PGA score of 0 or 1 among participants with a baseline pp-PGA score ≥3
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of palmoplantar psoriasis as measured by pp-PGA.

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
a. For participants with plaque psoriasis: i. Stable plaque psoriasis for at least 6 months ii. Moderate to severe disease iii. Candidate for phototherapy or systemic therapy b. Additional protocol-specified inclusion criteria apply for subjects with psoriatic arthritis, erythrodermic psoriasis, or generalized pustular psoriasis
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Guttate, inverse, or drug-induced psoriasis at Screening or Baseline
2. History of recent infection
3. Prior exposure to BMS-986165
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply

facility.name: University of Occupational and Environmental Health, Japan
National Hospital Organization Yokohama Medical Center
University Hospital - Kyoto Preferctural University of Medicine
Japan Community Health Care Organization Tokyo Yamate Medical Center
